legacy.full_text: Looks like they materialized from the replicator
@shivon @grok what is the material that is wrapped around the glasses?

@PhilsPhanTom @shivon The material wrapped around the glasses is likely salt, commonly used on margarita rims to enhance flavor by balancing sweet and sour notes. Coarse sea salt or kosher salt is typical, though flavored salts like chili-lime add a unique twist.
@grok @shivon @grok I mean the material that is lit and burns near the base of each glass.

@PhilsPhanTom @shivon Likely high-proof alcohol (e.g., overproof or 151-proof rum) burns near the glass base, possibly with a sugar cube as a wick. Cinnamon may be sprinkled for sparks, enhancing the theatrical cocktail display. https://t.co/ISbWbJTky7 https://t.co/eAzQ4h3sdK https://t.co/JIg0ukgh3S
